word: great sand dunes national park and preserve

uk: ˌɡreɪt ˌsænd dʒuːnz ˌnæʃ.ən.əl pɑːk ən prɪˈzɜːv
us: ˌɡreɪt ˌsænd duːnz ˌnæʃ.ən.əl pɑːrk ən prɪˈzɜ˞ːv

body_content.explanation: a national park (= a large area of land protected by the government because of its natural beauty or because it has a special history) in the US state of Colorado:
examples: Great Sand Dunes was made a national monument in 1932 by president Herbert Hoover, protecting only the main dunefield.
Great Sand Dunes hosts more than 150 species of birds and a surprisingly large number are year-round residents.
